reason.tex: \int_0^a f(x)\cdot dx = \int_0^a f(a-x)\cdot dx\text{ is a known}\\ \text{property of integrals. Therefore, }\\ \begin{align} \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \cos^2 x\cdot dx &= \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \left[\cos \left(\frac\pi{2}-x\right)\right]^2\cdot dx \\ &= \int_0^\frac\pi{2} \sin^2 x\cdot dx \end{align}

\text{If you see a }\sin^2 x\text{ and a }\cos^2 x\text{, then try}\\ \text{and add them. That is what we have done here.} \\ \text{We also used the fact that }\\ \int_a^b f(x)\cdot dx + \int_a^b g(x) \cdot dx = \int_a^b [f(x) + g(x)] \cdot dx.
